revised_title: Pleistocene History and Evolution of the Vale of St. Albans
tldr: The article investigates the Pleistocene history and evolution of the Vale of St. Albans, focusing on the stratigraphy of the deposits and its connection to the River Thames. The study reveals the area's glacial history, including two major ice advances during the Anglian glacial stage, which caused the river to be diverted and eventually led to the formation of the modern river valleys. The research provides a better understanding of the area's geological past and the development of the River Thames.
